Package controller

Class AlbumViewController

java.lang.Object
controller.AlbumViewController
public class AlbumViewController
extends java.lang.Object
The Album Controller manipulates the photo list and feeds new updates into the list viewer. There are different functionalities that are implemented for an album on specific photos.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    AlbumViewController()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void handleAddPhotoButton()
    Handles the Add photo functionality, by loading the photo from the file chooser by calling photo model and storing the photo in album after checking the photo is new, as well as updating the photo list viewer.
    void handleAlterPhotoButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    Handles the copy and move button events, depending on specific button a specific textfield is enabled as well as confirm button text is changed.
    void handleBackButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    Handles the back button and takes back user to the UserDashboard.
    void handleCancelButton()
    Handles the Cancel event, and confirms with user if user wants to cancel the action.
    void handleConfirmButton()
    Handles the confirm button cases.
    void handleDeletePhotoButton()
    Handles the delete button and removes the selected photo from the album.
    void handleLogoutButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    At any given point the user can logout and it will take user to the main login screen.
    void handleOpenPhotoButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
    Handles an event to open the selected photo by calling the loader to open photo viewer and setting a new stage.
    void start​(java.util.ArrayList<User> users, User user, Album selectedAlbum)
    On start the users, current user and selected albums are initialized.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • AlbumViewController

      public AlbumViewController()

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start​(java.util.ArrayList<User> users, User user, Album selectedAlbum)
      On start the users, current user and selected albums are initialized. as well as all the photos from the selected album are set on the list viewer.
      Parameters:
      users - takes the users list.
      user - takes current logged in user.
      selectedAlbum - takes the selected album from the list of albums.

    • handleAddPhotoButton

      public void handleAddPhotoButton()
      Handles the Add photo functionality, by loading the photo from the file chooser by calling photo model and storing the photo in album after checking the photo is new, as well as updating the photo list viewer. And saves the data using common function.

    • handleAlterPhotoButton

      public void handleAlterPhotoButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the copy and move button events, depending on specific button a specific textfield is enabled as well as confirm button text is changed.
      Parameters:
      event - takes the mouse event.

    • handleCancelButton

      public void handleCancelButton()
      Handles the Cancel event, and confirms with user if user wants to cancel the action. Sets the specific confirm button to normal confirm button.

    • handleConfirmButton

      public void handleConfirmButton()
      Handles the confirm button cases. Depending on specific case, it either re-caption the photo, or moves the photo or copies the photo. Also checks for the error cases if on copy or move duplicate photos will exist. And saves the data using common function.

    • handleDeletePhotoButton

      public void handleDeletePhotoButton()
      Handles the delete button and removes the selected photo from the album.

    • handleOpenPhotoButton

      public void handleOpenPhotoButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles an event to open the selected photo by calling the loader to open photo viewer and setting a new stage.
      Parameters:
      event - takes the mouse event

    • handleBackButton

      public void handleBackButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handles the back button and takes back user to the UserDashboard.
      Parameters:
      event - takes the mouse event.

    • handleLogoutButton

      public void handleLogoutButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      At any given point the user can logout and it will take user to the main login screen.
      Parameters:
      event - takes the mouse event.
